translated: The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules🔽The sub-chapter on respect
The training rule on making a mound of almsfood

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū thūpakato omadditvā piṇḍapātaṁ bhuñjanti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū thūpakataḥ omadditvā piṇḍapātam bhuñjanti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six were making a mound of almsfood and then eating it. …

original: “Na thūpakato omadditvā piṇḍapātaṁ bhuñjissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: na thūpakataḥ omadditvā piṇḍapātam bhuñjissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not make a mound of almsfood and then eat it,’ this is how you should train.”
One should not make a mound of almsfood and then eat it.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca thūpakato omadditvā piṇḍapātaṁ bhuñjati āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—🔽asañcicca,
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca thūpakataḥ omadditvā piṇḍapātam bhuñjati āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti  a san cit ca
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes a mound of almsfood and then eats it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
There is no offense if he does not do it out of disrespect;
if he does not know;🔽if he is not aiming at disrespect;

original: parittake sese ekato saṅkaḍḍhitvā omadditvā bhuñjati,
analyzed: parittake sese ekatas saṅkaḍḍhitvā omadditvā bhuñjati
translated: if there is only a little left and he mixes it all together and then eats it;
if he is the first offender.🔽The fifth training rule is finished.
